message: Thoughts on Ubisoft moving into the movie business? Looks like they're planning on releasing 3D movies for Splinter Cell, Assassin's Creed and Ghost Recon.

The Assassin's Creed Lineage movie they did for AC2 wasn't too bad. I can imagine with a bigger budget that it could be something worthwhile watching.

The fact that they're targeting 3D doesn't exactly fill me with confidence though.

What's worse, is trying to find a cinema that's showing the 2D version. 

But I guess as long as they shoot the films in 3D, and don't rely on adding it during post production, it'll be a little less painful.
I'll watch the Assassin's Creed movie, certainly, but I don't really have high hopes for any of them yet.
Then again, I dare you to try to find an upcoming big budget movie that's NOT in 3D.

It's pretty ironic that 3D -- an expensive ploy to get people back in the cinema -- is more likely to push me into waiting and just getting the blu-ray. I'm so done with blurry, dim 3D. </roger ebert>
I still like it, but I'm saving it for Pixar films.
...who are the only ones getting 3D right.
